turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about South Shore (Long Island).
turn.1: What is the South Shore of Long Island?
turn.2: South Shore (Long Island) The South Shore of Long Island, in the U.S. state of New York, is the area along Long Island's Atlantic Ocean shoreline.
turn.3: Is the South Shore part of Queens?
turn.4: Though some consider the South Shore to include parts of Queens, particularly the beach communities in the Rockaways such as Belle Harbor, the term is generally used to refer to the Long Island coastline in Nassau and Suffolk counties.
turn.5: Is the term used in any other context?
turn.6: It is often used as a generic name for the entire southern half of Long Island rather than just the area immediately adjacent to the coastline.
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: The South Shore tends to be diverse in culture and income as it varies from one hamlet or village to another.
turn.9: What are some of the wealthiest people in the world?
turn.10: In Suffolk County, there still remains pockets of old money from the Gilded Age, including the country seats of families from the Vanderbilts, Havemeyers, and Bournes to the Gardiners, Bayard-Cutting as well as many others.
turn.11: Is the area a popular place to live?
turn.12: The South Shore is also home to the world-renowned seaside resort of The Hamptons on its east end, located on the South Fork of Long Island.
